title: The Frankl-Pach upper bound is not tight for any uniformity
authors:
Gennian Ge and Zixiang Xu and Chi Hoi Yip and Shengtong Zhang and
  Xiaochen Zhao
abstract:
For any positive integers $n\ge d+1\ge 3$, what is the maximum size of a
$(d+1)$-uniform set system in $[n]$ with VC-dimension at most $d$? In 1984,
Frankl and Pach initiated the study of this fundamental problem and provided an
upper bound $\binom{n}{d}$ via an elegant algebraic proof. Surprisingly, in
2007, Mubayi and Zhao showed that when $n$ is sufficiently large and $d$ is a
prime power, the Frankl-Pach upper bound is not tight. They also remarked that
their method requires $d$ to be a prime power, and asked for new ideas to
improve the Frankl-Pach upper bound without extra assumptions on $n$ and $d$.
  In this paper, we provide an improvement for any $d\ge 2$ and $n\ge 2d+2$,
which demonstrates that the long-standing Frankl-Pach upper bound
$\binom{n}{d}$ is not tight for any uniformity. Our proof combines a simple yet
powerful polynomial method and structural analysis.
